titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage which has resulted in a number of holes in the body of the letter that make the text difficult to read in places.

mods.abstract: The letter concerns private intelligence received from Baghdad, regarding a range of diplomatic matters; it includes the appointment of Arthur Paget as British Ambassador to the Ottoman Empire and the appointment of General Gerdanne as French ambassador to the Persian Court. Furthermore, it notes information concerning the progress of peace negotiations between Russia and Persia.
